intro: Thibaudia punctata, commonly known as the spotted thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive red center. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Thibaudia punctata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
